abstract.text: How to play, skip, pause and seek through content

inlineContent.text: In order to use playback controls, AutomixIQ needs to be Initialised and On. Please see
Use the AutomixSDK Singleton to control playback of the playlist. Actions supported are:
AutomixIQ can be configured to not play (skip over, mix out of) tracks with explicit content. To do that, use:

If this filtering is enabled when the current track is not explicit, then AutomixIQ will ensure the mix skips over tracks with explicit content by creating a mix between the current track and the first non-explicit track. If no non-explicit track is available, then AutomixIQ will act as if that track is the end of the playlist. If replay is on, then it will look from the beginning of the playlist to find the next non-explicit track.

If this filtering is enabled when the current track is explicit, then AutomixIQ will automatically skip to the first available non-explicit track. If no non-explicit track is available, then AutomixIQ will act as if that track is the end of the playlist. If replay is on, then it will look from the beginning of the playlist to find the next non-explicit track.

abstract.text: How to validate your client and start using the AutomixIQ SDK with Tuned Global APIs
Sets the AutomixIQ SDK play speed to a given value between 0.5 and 2. 0.5 is playback at half speed, 2 is playback at double speed
Enable smooth transitions between tracks for a seamlessly beat-matched experience within your iOS music application.
Loads an empty playlist, affectively resetting the state
Sets the AutomixIQ SDK volume to a given value between 0 and 1. If muted, calling this will cause the AutomixIQ SDK to unmute.
Sets the filter explicit lyrics flag.

When raised, the AutomixIQ SDK will skip over the tracks that have explicit content flag set in their metadata by mixing the currently playing track with the first available non-explicit track in the queue.
Sets a new order to the playlist while continuing to play the current track
Pauses playback if playing.
If already paused it does nothing.
Moves the track from one index to a different index
Makes the AutomixIQ SDK stop looping the currently playing track
Jumps playback to the beginning of the track at the desired index as soon as possible.
Makes playback go to the beginning of the previous track

doc://org.cocoapods.AutomixIQ/documentat.title: Switching between AutomixIQ player and any other player

abstract.text: How to toggle the AutomixIQ player on and off
Adds additional tracks to a playlist in the AutomixIQ SDK at a given index.
If the index is out of bounds it does nothing.
Makes the AutomixIQ SDK play a given track until the end and then pause. If you run this on the last track it will fail.
Sets the AutomixIQ SDK mute
Loads a new playlist into Automix SDK.
If the playlist is empty this opperation will fail and Automix SDK will be turned off
This will stop playback of the playlist currently playing and start the new one.
Sets the AutomixIQ SDK preferred transition duration - transitions will not be exactly this duration but AutomixIQ will favour transitions with duration close to this one
Setting it to 0 disables this hint and allows the engine to select the transition duration based on trained genre-based transition data.
Removes a track from the playlist in the AutomixIQ SDK at a given index.
If the index is out of bounds it does nothing.
Makes playback go to the beginning of the current track
If on, after a playlist is done it restarts. Otherwise, it pauses.
Jumps playback on the current track to the desired timestamp as soon as possible.
This will mix the track with itself so the seek is beatmatched and as unnoticeable as possible, which means the landing position will be close but not exactly the fed timestamp.
Starts playback if paused.
If already playing it does nothing.
Enables / Disables vinyl pause sound effect
Makes playback go to the beginning of the next track
Adds a single track to a playlist in the AutomixIQ SDK at a given index.
If the index is out of bounds it does nothing.
Makes the AutomixIQ SDK loop the currently playing track
